channel.title: CVE Feed for wpzoom -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for wpzoom -- all products

item.title: CVE-2024-5686|2024-07-02T19:34:11.406Z -- wpzoom -- wpzoom%20addons%20for%20elementor%20%28templates%2C%20widgets%29
item.description: The WPZOOM Addons for Elementor (Templates, Widgets) plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘url’ attribute within the plugin's Team Members widget in all versions up to, and including, 1.1.38 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-5147|2024-06-04T18:01:55.868Z -- wpzoom -- wpzoom%20addons%20for%20elementor%20%28templates%2C%20widgets%29
item.description: The WPZOOM Addons for Elementor (Templates, Widgets) plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Local File Inclusion in all versions up to, and including, 1.1.37 via the 'grid_style' parameter. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to include and execute arbitrary files on the server, allowing the execution of any PHP code in those files. This can be used to bypass access controls, obtain sensitive data, or achieve code execution in cases where images and other “safe” file types can be uploaded and included.

item.title: CVE-2024-4370|2024-06-06T19:49:13.482Z -- wpzoom -- wpzoom%20addons%20for%20elementor%20%28templates%2C%20widgets%29
item.description: The WPZOOM Addons for Elementor (Templates, Widgets) plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's widget Image Box in all versions up to, and including, 1.1.36 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-22162|2024-01-31T18:00:09.781Z -- wpzoom -- wpzoom%20shortcodes
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in WPZOOM Shortcodes allows Reflected XSS.This issue affects WPZOOM Shortcodes: from n/a through 1.0.1.

item.title: CVE-2024-33539|2024-04-29T05:23:30.661Z -- wpzoom -- wpzoom%20addons%20for%20elementor%20%28templates%2C%20widgets%29
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in WPZOOM WPZOOM Addons for Elementor (Templates, Widgets) allows Stored XSS.This issue affects WPZOOM Addons for Elementor (Templates, Widgets): from n/a through 1.1.35.

item.title: CVE-2024-30464|2024-06-10T13:33:21.137Z -- wpzoom -- social%20icons%20widget%20%26%20block%20by%20wpzoom
item.description: Missing Authorization vulnerability in WPZOOM Social Icons Widget & Block by WPZOOM.This issue affects Social Icons Widget & Block by WPZOOM: from n/a through 4.2.15.

item.title: CVE-2024-3662|2024-06-06T18:28:29.195Z -- wpzoom -- wpzoom%20social%20feed%20widget%20%26%20block
item.description: The WPZOOM Social Feed Widget & Block plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access due to a missing capability check on the wpzoom_instagram_clear_data() function in all versions up to, and including, 2.1.13. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber-level access and above, to delete all Instagram images installed on the site.

item.title: CVE-2024-2183|2024-06-04T17:30:31.437Z -- wpzoom -- beaver%20builder%20addons%20by%20wpzoom
item.description: The Beaver Builder Addons by WPZOOM plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the Heading widget in all versions up to, and including, 1.3.4 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page. CVE-2024-30424 is likely a duplicate of this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-2185|2024-06-04T17:30:07.888Z -- wpzoom -- beaver%20builder%20addons%20by%20wpzoom
item.description: The Beaver Builder Addons by WPZOOM plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the Image Box widget in all versions up to, and including, 1.3.4 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-2186|2024-04-09T18:58:57.763Z -- wpzoom -- beaver%20builder%20addons%20by%20wpzoom
item.description: The Beaver Builder Addons by WPZOOM plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the Team Members widget in all versions up to, and including, 1.3.4 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-2187|2024-06-04T17:29:42.371Z -- wpzoom -- beaver%20builder%20addons%20by%20wpzoom
item.description: The Beaver Builder Addons by WPZOOM plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the Testimonials widget in all versions up to, and including, 1.3.4 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-2181|2024-06-04T17:29:04.296Z -- wpzoom -- beaver%20builder%20addons%20by%20wpzoom
item.description: The Beaver Builder Addons by WPZOOM plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the Button widget in all versions up to, and including, 1.3.4 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.
